page.title: 01GENERAL DESC. E.of OFFCHURCH
page.content: This is a mainly rural area, only touching part of the village of {Offchurch}at its western edge. To the east,{Long Itchington}is the next village and to the north,{Hunningham. The main thoroughfare is the{Fosse {Way}running North/South. Classed as a minor road it nevertheless carries a volume of fast traffic. Local traffic, commuting from{Leamington}to the nearby villages uses the{Welsh Road and the road from{Offchurch}to{Long {Itchington. The land comes to its highest point at the top of{Snowford Hill}and then drops away rapidly to the East on the plain of the{River Itchen. The{Grand Union Canal}crosses the south of the area and is well used by holiday makers. A bus links{Leamington}with{Radford, {Offchurch, Long Itch.}and{Stockton.
